p: It is advised that HIV must be excluded in every patient with encephalitis for a number of reasons. Patients may present with acute meningoencephalitis during the primary HIV-1 infection or longstanding encephalopathy. HIV predisposes the patient to other rarer CNS infections, such as CMV, and the incidence of common CNS infections is higher in HIV-infected patients [ 10]. Other additional investigations are selectively requested on the basis of specific systemic involvement.
